en-gb: Students are sitting outside a house drinking verbally abusing local community members. Reported on INSPECT by a citizen.
Other local citzens experiencing similar issue, bottles and cans being thrown onto the road. (should university be made aware)
Police call past and warn students about their behaviour and the students go into the house.
After police leave students appear out again verbally abusing nextdoor neighbours for calling the police. Neighbours report through INSPECT.
Asking other citizens to assist or warn students. (This is a volatile situation citizens have been abused, possible injury if hit by bottle) Use INSPECT APP only. Detailed info provided via posts.
Police remove the alcohol and enforce drinking bye-laws and ensure the students take the seats etc back into their house.

Citizens complain (supported by police) to the local universities and City council. Actions initative where the students receive formal warnings and the council clear the debris erecting no drinking bye law signs around the area.
An elderly woman has had her purse stolen from her house through an open window
A witness can offer a vague description but no direction of travel
A student has had his mobile phone stolen from his hall table in his house whilst he was upstairs
Further more detailed description and photograph is provided giving a direction of travel of the criminal
A citizen has seen the elderly thief acting suspiciously outside a house in the area where the front door appears open. Photograph uploaded

Thanks to the stored data in the INSPEC2T system, the coordinator sends via INSPEC2T app images of the suspect to the CPO. The witness recognises it to be the elderly man seen committing the first theft and the images is sent to the patrols in the area who have now arrested the individual
The police retrace the criminal's steps via the citizen sightings on INSPEC2T and locate the stolen items hidden on the way
A mother has added a post claiming her 5-year-old daughter has gone missing from her front garden. She has uploaded a recent photograph. The weather is cold and it is getting dark
Two sightings have been made by citizens who claim to have seen a girl with an unknown male heading towards the river area.
Uploaded photographs have proved that a child with an unknown male is not the missing child
An INSPEC2T member posts having seen a child fitting the description on the other sider of the area playing with other children
One INSPEC2T user approaches the children to bring the missing girl home but is challenged by local adults about approaching children
Police officers arrive and using the details provided on INSPEC2T identify the missing child and take her home
Police return the child to her mother and the benefits of the INSPEC2T platform are realised and appreciated. Community confidence in the police is improved greatly
A lady has returned to her parked car to find the passenger window has been broken and her handbag has been stolen.
Two sightings have been made by citizens who claim to have  seen two youths acting suspiciously in the area trying parked car doors.
Uploaded photographs have been posted of the youths by a member of the community.
An INSPEC2T member posts having seen two youths, fitting the posted descriptions, emptying the contents of a bag out in an entry in the near vicinity.

One INSPEC2T user checks the entry and retrieves some items including a handbag, cards, driving licence and other personal documents. The witness posts seeing the youths trying car doors in the next street along and is watching the youths from a discreet distance.
Police officers arrive and using the details provided on INSPEC2T arrest the two youths and recover a purse containing cash, credit cards and house keys.

Police return the items to the lady owner identified through the credit cards and details on INSPEC2T. The benefits of the INSPEC2T input are realized and appreciated. Two criminals are arrested and charged with theft. Community confidence in the police is improved
Failure to respond has allowed the two youths to escape, community confidence damaged
A woman has had her purse stolen at the supermarket.
Another woman has had her purse stolen at the same supermarket
A witness posts a vague description of clothes that the suspected criminal is wearing

While police patrols are looking for the suspect, another customer of the supermarket posts that a male tried to steal his wallet on the way in and that the culprit is making his way up Agincourt Avenue. A full description is given
The thief is not apprehended and is not seen again
A ctizen reports having seen a male fitting the description of the thieft stuffing a bag behind a lamppost in Agincourt Avenue and making off.

Thanks to the stored data in the INSPEC2T system, the coordinator sends via INSPEC2T app images of the suspect fitting the description provided. The witness recognises one of them as the thief and police apprehend him. The stolen items are missing
The police search the area identified by citizens and recover two purses and a wallet, all of which are returned to their owners

A number local citizens have reported that an elderly male has been indecently exposing himself to females in the vicinity of a woman’s sheltered accommodation building in the Lower Ormeau area of Belfast.

Two separate women have complained about a male exposing himself to them, giving a description of him and his clothing. There was no mention of any violent behaviour or threats from the man. The shelter warden has also made a complaint on behalf of two residents.
A beat officer responds to the area of the woman’s sheltered accommodation. The culprit sees the officer arriving and makes off.
A group of young girls complain that an elderly male has exposed himself to them outside a play park area in the Lower Ormeau.
The elderly male has not been located due to a failure to send officers to apprehend him. Community are not impressed with police actions

One INSPEC2T user posts a complete description of the culprit including his current location outside the play park. The citizen has recorded the culprit exposing himself and sends it through the system.
Police promptly respond and arrest the man fitting the description on INSPEC2T and matching the video images.
Due to the support of the info submitted through INSPEC2T further reports of indecent exposure were investigated and proved against the arrested man.

Several concerned students have posted messages on INSPECT about a missing girl, who is their friend, claiming she may be suicidal. They have also posted photographs of her and descriptions of her clothing.

A shop owner post seeing the girl in the photo on INSPECT in his hardware shop. He says she bought a long rope and was upset. He was worried about her mental state. Full description of her clothing and she walked towards the river Lagan
Police speak to the shop owner but there are no further details. Police patrol the area but no sight of the missing girl.
Another citizen posts a photo of the girl beside the bridge
One anonymous citizen claims to have seen the girl on the Ormeau Bridge staring down into the water. Gives an exact location.
The police negotiation team arrive and try to talk the girl down but she is unresponsive and there is a standoff with the girl threatening to jump hanging herself.
From the info on INSPECT (photos) the girl’s friends confirm her identity and post some ideas directly to the police about what might help encourage her off the bridge.
Police use the info provided on INSPECT to form a structured approach plan and convince her to come down from the bridge.
Several local citizens have reported waste being dumped in various derelict sites in the Holylands area. They report what looks like hazardous waste.
Several citizen post complaints about rat infestations around the derelict sites where waste has been dumped. It also appears that there is dangerous including medical waste dumped.
Police arrive in the area and check the derelict sites. They seal the area off and call in specialist council cleaners to remove the waste and deal with the infestation.
A citizen posts a description and photograph of the van which has been dumping the waste.
Two separate reports are posted claiming to have seen the identified van driving slowly past derelict sites and having parked on Rugby Road beside a derelict site.
A report is posted claiming that an angry mob of local residents are making their way to Rugby Road and intend confronting the occupants of the van described earlier on INSPEC2T.

The police arrive at Rugby Road before the mob with council Officials, seize the van and arrest the occupants who have provided false details, the van was also found to be stolen. The mob arrive, are pleased with the resolution and disperse peacefully.
A number local citizens have reported hearing automatic gunfire in the Lower Ormeau area near a hotel.
Citizen There are now several posts on INSPEC2T identifying that a lone male with an automatic rifle is walking up Rugby Road

Police respond and the male flees into the back streets and alleys. Crime report on INSPEC 2 Tfrom police highlight several people have been shot in a local hotel and that an armed and dangerous male is at large.

A citizen reports seeing a male hiding behind a wall in a poorly lit up area of the Holylands and gives a brief description of him. The citizen notes he is close to bar and that it is nearly closing time.
The police response has caused the offender to flee and go into hiding. The police use the INSPECT to deliver safety notices to the general public and keep people safe.
The area goes very quiet and the male shooter is photographed by a citizen hiding behind a parked car. The photograph shows the exact location of the male and a clear image of his face.

Using the data available on INSPEC2T Police can quickly form a plan of approach, they can also identify the individual through the facial recognition software and research him. The plan is executed precisely and the culprit arrested without further gun shots being discharged.

A local resident has reported a suspicious caller at their house with what appeared to be false ID claiming to be from the City council checking local homes for damp. A full description was posted also, along council contact details to check such caller’s authenticity. Several residents have come forward saying they have lost personal items from their recently and all after an inspection of their homes for damp by the City Council.

A citizen reports that two males claiming to be from the council called at her house and forced their way in when asked them to wait while she checked their authenticity. They assaulted her and stole her purse. She posted descriptions of the men and
Police call with the victim and patrol the area but there is no sign of the culprits. Police post a warning, advice and more in depth descriptions of the culprits.
An INSPEC2T member posts having seen a car, fitting the description posted earlier, pulling up outside an elderly neighbours house and are knocking the door.

One INSPEC2T user posts, prior to police arrival, that the males did not gain entry and were driving off up Cromwell Road. Another citizen confirms this and pinpoints the vehicle with two males in it parked near the Botanic Avenue junction.
Police officers arrive and using the details provided on INSPEC2T identify the vehicle and arrest the culprits who tried to make off on foot when they saw police arriving.

Police return to the car and locate several purses and a quantity of stolen jewelry which is identified by the INSPEC2T users. The benefits of the INSPEC 2 T input are realized and appreciated. Community confidence in the police is improved greatly.
